work.summary:
I support the some pretty exciting engineering teams at Target
* the team that is building Target's Internet of Things Platform (IoTP) to provide a common platform for connected devices at Target's stores and Distribution centers. 
* Target Application Platform (TAP) - Target’s Platform as a Service that enables developers to build, run and operate applications entirely in cloud – be it our data centers, Google Cloud or edge locations.
* Target's API Platform - api.target.com - providing reusable patterns to make business logic accessible to build upon.
* Release and Runtime engineering team - Target's public cloud team - managing access, deployments, and spend.
* Streaming data - Target's events platform for publishing and subscribing to events.
* Managed File Transfer - everything from EDI to SFTP; how Target shares files with partners. 
* Praxis, our internal React framework and the Target Application Platform backed by our API Platform and Data as a Service to stand up applications rapidly.
Independent consultant and contractor. Providing hands-on engineering and design consultation.
Working hard to deliver a self-service streaming data platform for all of Capital One.  Working with other teams to provide governance and discoverability to enable teams to unlock the value of data

Managed software development teams in a various areas of Capital One retail bank that provided middleware platforms for web and mobile products. Recruited and mentored engineering talent to grow and bolster a cohesive team. Restructured teams into self-organizing units that organize around their own decision making and estimating resulting in increased engagement and quality.

Engineering Director for "Guest Fulfillment Engineering" : Availability, Flexible Fulfillment, and Guest facing allocation  -  Availability, Estimated Delivery Dates, "Available to Promise", "Find it in a Target Store", "Add to Cart", "Order By Get By", "Buy online pickup in Store", "Ship to Store" and other related products.

Engineering manager - Architect for the inventory vertical in Target's "Available to Promise" product team. "Available to Promise" (ATP) seeks to prevent oversell by capturing customer demand at the time of purchase and showing accurate real-time inventory across Target's 1800+ stores and other fulfillment centers.

* Strong focus on data modeling and schema design for Apache Cassandra/Datastax Enterprise Edition
* Responsible for creation of enterprise service requirements.

* Creation of service specifications, schemas, canonical models, nonfunctional requirements 
* Oversight of testing from a business and SLA perspective 

Technologies / Tools

Part of the Hennepin Justice Integration Project (HJIP). Developing  platforms through service orientated architecture (SOA)  to integrate different City, County, and State systems.

references.name: Jim Kamin (Assistant Public Defender)
references.reference: Jim Beyers manages a multi-faceted IT strategic plan for the Public Defender's Office.  His responsibilities include supervision of IT staff (BA's, developers, desktop support staff, data entry personnel), vendor management, development work, architectural design, business roll-out and prioritizations.  In each of these roles, Jim does an excellent job, particularly in identifying and seizing opportunities to implement IT solutions to business practice problems.  He does these duties with energy, commitment, intelligence and good humor.  This is an unconditional recommendation.
